metadata.Title: CVE-2023-26604 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
systemd before 247 does not adequately block local privilege escalation forsome Sudo configurations, e.g., plausible sudoers files in which the"systemctl status" command may be executed. Specifically, systemd does notset LESSSECURE to 1, and thus other programs may be launched from the lessprogram. This presents a substantial security risk when running systemctlfrom Sudo, because less executes as root when the terminal size is toosmall to show the complete systemctl output.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-26604` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 249.11-0ubuntu3.6
libnss-mymachines - 249.11-0ubuntu3.6
libnss-resolve - 249.11-0ubuntu3.6
libnss-systemd - 249.11-0ubuntu3.6
libpam-systemd - 249.11-0ubuntu3.6
libsystemd0 - 249.11-0ubuntu3.6
libudev1 - 249.11-0ubuntu3.6
systemd - 249.11-0ubuntu3.6
systemd-container - 249.11-0ubuntu3.6
systemd-coredump - 249.11-0ubuntu3.6
systemd-journal-remote - 249.11-0ubuntu3.6
systemd-oomd - 249.11-0ubuntu3.6
systemd-repart - 249.11-0ubuntu3.6
systemd-standalone-sysusers - 249.11-0ubuntu3.6
systemd-standalone-tmpfiles - 249.11-0ubuntu3.6
systemd-sysv - 249.11-0ubuntu3.6
systemd-tests - 249.11-0ubuntu3.6
systemd-timesyncd - 249.11-0ubuntu3.6
udev - 249.11-0ubuntu3.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '249.11-0ubuntu3.6').
